did.unittitle: Herbert A. Laitinen collection of materials relating to I.M. Kolthoff

bioghist.p: Izaak Maurits (Piet) Kolthoff (1894- 1993) was born in Holland and received his Ph.D. in 1918 from the University of Utrecht. He remained there as Lecturer until 1927, when he took the position of Professor of Analytical Chemistry at the University of Minnesota. He remained active in research throughout his career. He was made Professor Emeritus in 1962. He published more than 950 papers during his career. Herbert Laitinen (1915-1991) joined the faculty of the University of Illinois in 1940, the same year he received his doctorate from the University of Minnesota where he studied under I. M. Kolthoff. For several years, Laitinen taught inorganic and general chemistry; in 1947 he began teaching analytical chemistry. He became head of the Analytical Chemistry division in 1953. He was the editor of Analytical Chemistry from 1966 to 1979. Laitinen had varied research interests. He was a leader in synthetic rubber research during the Second World War. He also conducted research in electrochemistry, polarography, diffusion, polarization of microelectrodes, environmental science, and surface chemistry.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of correspondence between Kolthoff and Laitinen between 1937 to 1989, with some gaps. The collection also includes letters from other chemists, biographical sketches of Kolthoff, a list of Kolthoff's graduate students between 1936 and 1960, a brochure from the 1972 dedication of Kolthoff and Smith Halls at the University of Minnesota, reprints, and miscellaneous clippings.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
